message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the problem of learning textual entailment models with limited supervision, which is a common problem in natural language processing. The paper proposes two complementary approaches for this problem, one of which involves using adversarial example generators to incorporate large lexical resources in entailment models via only a handful of rule templates. This suggests that the paper is likely to be relevant to the sub-categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper proposes a GAN-style approach for training the entailment model, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-categories of neural networks (cs.NE) and information retrieval (cs.IR).
